Key Match Events: Kawhi Leonard made his return to the court after a 253-day absence and played 19 minutes, scoring 12 points in the Clippers' 131-105 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.
Pre-Game Insights: Kawhi Leonard stated that playing for the first time in 253 days was the 'easy part' and that the hard part was not playing and rehabilitating.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Ty Lue mentioned that Kawhi's presence on the floor makes it easier for everyone else and that they will continue to progress every game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kawhi Leonard received a warm reception in his first game at the Clippers' $2-billion Intuit Dome.
Others: Kawhi Leonard was 4-of-11 from the floor and 3-of-5 from deep, and Norm Powell led the Clippers with 20 points.
